711953f-b.title: Manhattan: 30th Street (East) - Lexington Avenue
711953f-b.text:
(1)
Eaot 30th Street, at, adjoining and west of the N.W. corner of
Lexington Ave. In the background appears the Empire State Building.
Pebruary 22, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same. Building bearing flag is the School of Applied Design
for Women.
February 23, 1931.
L. Sperr.  i3 aEPRODUcrIoNs.

720943f.title: Manhattan: Lexington Avenue - 30th Street (East)
720943f.text:
165 Lexington Avenue, adjoining the N. E. corner of
East 30th Street. Subsecuently a one story store
front was added to this building. At the right is
the Hotel Rutledge, a structure that occupies the
site at the N. E. corner.
Erior to 1914
Anonymous gift
James Suydam, photo
MAY BE REPRODUCED

720945f-a.title: Manhattan: Lexington Avenue - 30th Street (East)
720945f-a.text:
Lexington Ave., east side, south from East 30th Street, showing two
blocks of uniform 4-story structures between this point and 28th Street.
November 9, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

711954f-b.title: Manhattan: 30th Street (East) - Lexington Avenue
711954f-b.text:
East 30th Street, south side, east from Lexington and
across Third and Second (Elevated Lines thereonl Avenues.
November 9, 1937
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
(2)
132 to 140 East 30th Street, adjoining and east of
the S. E. corner of Lexington Avenue, showing an old group
of buildings. The two on the right occupy a 58 x 24.8
foot plot of which the latter is the depth. On the left
is a double structure giving the appearance of a single
building, dividing a frontage of 25.2 feet.
June, 1938
George D. Chinn
NO REPRODUCTIONS

720944f-b.title: Manhattan: Lexington Avenue - 30th Street
720944f-b.text:
(1)
Moravian Church, Lexington Ave.. at the S.W. corner of 30th
Street.
April 30, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, showing only the Lexington Ave. front. Note the Empire
Building overshadowing same.
October 2, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
Another view and including the New York School of Applied Design
for Women at the N.W. corner.
October 2, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

711955f-a.title: Manhattan: 30th Street (East) - Lexington Avenue
711955f-a.text:
134-142 East 30th Street, south side, east of Lexington
Avenue.
July 23, 1934
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
(2)
142 East 30th Street, south side, between Third
and Lexington Avenues, showing a 3-story building with
an old iron balcony. The wide entrance beneath same,
(right), leads thru a passageway to a 1-story brick and
frame rear building.
June, 1938
OEORGE D. CHINN
NO REPRODUCTIONS
